passages.name: toilet
passages.text:
<<set $toilet = true>>
That beige bathroom scale
doesn't measure your weight
but your worth.

You recall that
time when you actually
weighed less than dad.

And he, the feeder, refused
to give you that.

Kudos dad yet again!

You.. NO ONE can ever
be more worthy than he.

[[Look somewhere else|warmth]]

passages.name: kick
passages.text:
You have a kick in you that need to come out.

A SuperComboOfJeanClaudeVanDammeAndChuckNorrisMasterKICK!

A horrible little gopher comes to mind when you think on how to distribute the kick.

You find the gopher...AND HE SITS PERFECTLY IN FRONT OF A POND!

You stretch for a few seconds (so you don't pull a muscle).

Take aim! Charge! Jump!

That idiot literally didn't know what hit him.
Look at him now, trying to reach the surface.

[[Wreak more havoc!|unic]]

<<set $kick = true>>

passages.name: burntburger
passages.text:
<<set $burn = true>>
You are a bad male, not being able
to flip them burgers in time!

The burgers are now burnt and you
may [[carry on|carryon]] but with
shame as your companion.

passages.name: attic
passages.text:
<<set $attic = true>>
Dead rat carcass floats in dad's homemade trap.

1) Fill bucket with water
2) Pour some poison in water
3) Place ramp up towards bucket
4) Put cheese on top of ramp
5) Watch as ramp tips when rat tries to take the cheese

In a box in the farthest corner of the dark memory graveyard is a [[box|box]].

passages.name: money
passages.text:
<<set $money = true>>
There was a time when mom and dad competed
for your love by lavishing you with cash.

Disobliging and greedy
are two new traits imbedded in dad.

Finally the day came where
a gift is something transferred
to your account (mere pocket change)
as he pays other bills.

And why bother doing it the actual day you're actually born.
Maybe hard to remember or not worth it?

Stingy dad.
Stingy dad asking you what you want for your birhtday.

[[Inhale to answer|answer]]

passages.name: unicorn
passages.text:
You're a fucking awesome unicorn!

<<timedinsert 2s>>The forest is yours to rule!<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 4s>>Your deadly forehead penis is your scepter!<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedgoto "unic" 6s>>

passages.name: burntsausage
passages.text:
<<set $burn = true>>
You are a bad male, not being able
to flip them sausages in time!

The sausages are now burnt and you
may [[carry on|carryon]] but with
shame as your companion.

passages.name: skulk2
passages.text:
You've stumbled upon a part of the forest
you seldom visit. It borders the human world..

Behind a horrible shrubbery you spot two humans.

One long and one short - both are rotund like.

Boiling blood. Anger fills your veins.
Forgetting to blink due to fury causing you
to tear up. Tears of anger are seldom spoken of.
Their mere presence is infuriating..

[[The long|long]] one seems to strut alongside his
cooking device - flipping, what can only be unicorn meat (!!)

[[The short|short]] one parades around the lawn
seeking attention from the long one.

@@font-size: 150%;Who to impale?@@

passages.name: char
passages.text:
@@font-size: 70%;Choose a character! (finish the game to unlock the Unicorn)@@

[img[http://corruptreality.files.wordpress.com/2013/09/menu21.png]]

[[DAD|dad]] | [[CHILD|child]] | @@opacity: 0.3;UNICORN@@

passages.name: Start
passages.text:
[[b e g i n|title]]







@@font-size: 60%;Made by [[@PaperBlurt|https://twitter.com/paperblurt]]@@
@@font-size: 60%;More stuff at [[PaperBlurt.com|http://www.paperblurt.com]]@@

@@font-size: 50%; //(trigger warning: bullying, bad childhood, harsh language)//@@

passages.name: banish
passages.text:
This forest isn't big enough for all these animals!
That slimy frog bastard simply must go!

You find him on a lily pad, wallowing in sunrays - that lazy bum!

His leg feels like mushy, stale poo between your hooves as you grab him and carry his swinging body to the edge of the forest.

He begs you to let him stay as he's finally found
a home near the lake - but screw that!

You BANISH him!

"We'll mail your stuff!" (no we won't!)

[[Still hungry for chaos!|unic]] 

<<set $banish = true>>

passages.name: dmoney
passages.text:
"Why doesn't he get it? I'm old now and don't want to spend money on boring stuff. I've been paying bills for over 50 years, and have had plenty of children siphoning my wallet for cash."

@@font-size: 75%;3 children + 5 grandchildren + 1 partner = 9 birthday gifts/year (minimum)

3 children + 1 partner/child + 5 grandchildren + 1 partner x 4 X-Mas gifts (approx) = 48 X-Mas gifts.@@

That's a lot of money that could be spent on bowling.
Love is actually a formula.

[[choo choo|train]]

<<set $dmoney = true>>

passages.name: moped
passages.text:
<<set $moped = true>>
Masculinity is based on horsepower.

And who doesn't want his son
to have horsepower to the MAX?!

The moped bought in vain now acts as a shelf for mould
no one will ever touch.

Disappointment is so much worse than anger, sadness, fear or any
other emotion your dad doesn't feel.

You didn't fall in line with the rest of your batch.

Would it be easier to just be one of the boys?

[[Back to the box|box]]

passages.name: bedroom
passages.text:
<<set $bedroom = true>>
You're seldom in here.
Maybe the noises heard through the wall
acts as gatekeepers - not even wanting to look
into the room.

You can count the times you've
entered on one of your hands.

Grunting. Screaming. Moaning.
Something in the adult world
that's beautiful becomes pure
horror for a child.

You know what goes on in there.

You know as you've seen
dad's [[tapes|tapes]], hidden in the
bookshelf.

passages.name: gameover
passages.text:
@@font-size: 250%; GAME OVER!@@

You can now choose to play the game
yet again. But maybe with a different
character?

<<if $uni>>
<<else>>
@@font-size: 150%; UNICORN CHARACTER UNLOCKED!@@
<<endif>>

[[..once more?|startagain]]

passages.name: flipthem
passages.text:
@@font-size: 150%;Flip them sausages!@@

[[Flip em!|flipthem2]]

<<timedgoto "burntsausage" 2s>>

passages.name: unic
passages.text:
<<if $spit and $kick and $harass and $banish>><<else>>What do you wanna do now?<<endif>>
<<if $spit and $kick and $harass and $banish>><<timedinsert 2s>>@@font-size: 400%; I'm [[bored|bored]] now!!@@<<endtimedinsert>><<endif>>
<<if $spit>><<else>>[[Spit|spit]] a squirrel in the face!<<endif>>
<<if $kick>><<else>>[[Kick|kick]] a gopher in the stomach!<<endif>>
<<if $harass>><<else>>[[Harass|harass]] a moose until he cries!<<endif>>
<<if $banish>><<else>>[[Banish|banish]] a frog from the forest!<<endif>>

<<if $spit and $kick and $harass and $banish>><<else>>@@font-size: 150%; Time for awesomeness!!@@<<endif>>

passages.name: style
livingroom
passages.text:
<<set $tv = true>>
Fond memories.

Stallone's muscles melt us
into an action movie loving family.

We wished we could climb our
obstacles, our own mountains as
we united together in a
silent "hip hip hooray!!"
whilst watching Cliffhanger
that we rented in a nearby town.

Thank you Sly..

[[Where could dad be?|warmth]]

passages.name: dice
passages.text:
"Balancing on the ice like something's wrong. I never thought I'd have to struggle with a boy. Why can't stuff just work, and where do I return a boy with balance problems?"

Butt is hurting.
Tears adding to the frozen lake.

An embarrassing disappointment that
provided one with the power to lie.

"I have no skates"

You rather lie about poverty than ability.

[[choo choo|train]]

<<set $dice = true>>

passages.name: dsave
passages.text:
You sacrifice your food!!

.. and also, your son dies as
the unicorn's horn protrudes from his torso (funny word "protrude")..

Your mind fills with recipes based on what treasure
can be found in freezer, cabinets and the fridge.

The Unicorn stomps around, parading the corpse of
your, now late, son.

The body slowly slides down the horn - kids blood smearing all over
it. The unicorn walks up to a tree and manages to get
rid of the now uninteresting body.

Farewell unicorn you mighty fantasy stallion!

[[continue|gameover]]

<<set $two = true>>

passages.name: title
passages.text:
@@opacity: 0.5;dad vs. unicorn@@

<<timedgoto "char" 3.5s>>

passages.name: startagain
passages.text:
<<if $one and $two and $three>>@@font-size: 80%;You have now finished the game with all three characters,
but are free to replay it again.. of course.@@

@@font-size: 130%; just //[[restart|#restart]]//@@

<<else>>@@font-size: 70%;Choose a character!@@

[img[http://corruptreality.files.wordpress.com/2013/09/menu1.png]]

[[DAD|dad]] | [[CHILD|child]] | [[UNICORN|unicorn]]
<<endif>>

<<set $uni = true>>

passages.name: charge
passages.text:
@@font-size: 180%; The Unicorn explodes its humongous frame towards you and dad - with a glistening horn ready to kill!@@

[[Save dad!|save]]
[[Save me!|saveme]]

passages.name: long
passages.text:
The long one seems somewhat slow so you get
careless as you hide behind the shrubbery.

But he's dumb.. apparently. Taking no notice.
You jump out.

Jaws dropped (works every time).

You position your horn in a perfect angle
and before the long one even reacts to your
triumphant presence the human is impaled
by your mighty forehead horn!

It's so worth it to get blood
on the mane for that rush!

Another human's life has come to end..
..back to the forest!

[[continue|gameover]]

<<set $one = true>>

passages.name: short
passages.text:
You assume the short one is a "child".
And how often does one get the chance to
impale something where the brain isn't even fully-grown yet?

Horn is ready - the tip as sharp as your intellect!

Muscles tight and ready for slaughter.

You thrust your body towards the short one.
Stubby legs not able to save him.

Long one hides behind the cooking device.

Your awe-inspiring power almost rips the
small body in two, causing a kidney to fall out.

You fling the body away and grab the kidney (midnight snack)
and retreat back the way you came - passing by the shocked long human..

[[continue|gameover]]

<<set $one = true>>

passages.name: attack
passages.text:
@@font-size: 180%; Suddenly!

A huge fucking Unicorn leaps out from a shrubbery that desperately needs trimming!!@@

<<timedgoto "charge" 5s>>

passages.name: inline css
skates
passages.text:
<<set $skates = true>>
Patience is a virtue seldom distributed to all.

The ice was hard and the bruises reminds you
of how dad //facepalmed// himself some 20 years before you
even knew what it was.

Balancing on the ice,
tumbling over.

You're not as cute as Bambi I suppose.
Dad left.
You can't skate.
But you can lie.
So you lie about not having skates.
You guard other kids' backpacks instead.

[[Back to the box|box]]

passages.name: answer
passages.text:
..

Dad interrupts before you exhale.

"Because you know it's expensive
with all my bowling and travels
and maybe MOM can afford expensive
gifts right now, but I feel I
just want to focus on me and do
stuff that's fun"

You are not fun anymore.

[[Back to the box|box]]

passages.name: pee
passages.text:
Listen to how dad chops
up a new onion and fries a new batch.

[[Another room with less memories?|warmth]]

passages.name: fry
passages.text:
Nicely done!

[[Leave to pee|pee]]

passages.name: save
passages.text:
You die.
Dad survives.
He escapes inside
the house.

Animal Rescue arrives.
The unicorn is put down
and made in to steaks.

Meat for dad to BBQ!

[[continue|gameover]]

<<set $three = true>>

passages.name: warmth
passages.text:
<<if $bedroom and $daydream and $toilet and $tv and $kitchen and $attic>>
<<timedgoto "dadwhere" 0s>>
<<else>>
<<endif>>

<<if $attic>>
@@opacity:0.2;One storey house.. with an attic.@@
<<else>>
One storey house.. with an [[attic|attic]].
<<endif>>

<<if $kitchen>>
@@opacity:0.2;The kitchen is dad's
favorite and mom might be there too.@@
<<else>>
The [[kitchen|kitchen]] is dad's
favorite and mom might be there too.
<<endif>>
<<if $tv>>
@@opacity:0.2;But dad also likes TV - watching everything that's on.@@
<<else>>
But dad also likes [[TV|livingroom]] - watching everything that's on.
<<endif>>
<<if $toilet>>
@@opacity:0.2;At the same time as he sometime
takes a dump.@@
<<else>>
At the same time as he sometime
takes a [[dump|toilet]].
<<endif>>

<<if $daydream>>
@@opacity:0.2;Are you the last human in the world?
A sudden panic grabs hold of you.
Sorry to say but it's just
a daydream yet again.@@
<<else>>
Are you the last human in the world?
A sudden panic grabs hold of you.
Sorry to say but it's just
a [[daydream|daydream]] yet again.
<<endif>>

<<if $bedroom>>
@@opacity:0.2;The bedroom might be a good start?
Even though you seldom enter..@@
<<else>>
The [[bedroom|bedroom]] might be a good start?
Even though you seldom enter..
<<endif>>

<<if $bedroom and $daydream and $toilet and $tv and $kitchen and $attic>>
try the [[bbq|bbq]]
<<endif>>

passages.name: bbq
passages.text:
The smell is a fattening
temptress that has enslaved
dad..and dad has enslaved you.

Behind the grill.
Meat in front of him.
Smile on face.
The years have made a mark.

"I love barbeque!"
he exclaims and you
try to recall if "barbeque"
has ever been replaced by "you".

<<timedgoto "attack" 15s>>

passages.name: dad
passages.text:
Grilling meat is the most important task a man can take on.

<<timedgoto "flip" 4s>>

passages.name: flipthem2
passages.text:
Good work.

For the next couple of minutes..
.. dad's focus is elsewhere.

Trailing off.
Train of thought approaches.

<<timedgoto "train" 8s>>

passages.name: StoryTitle
passages.text: dad vs. unicorn

passages.name: spit
passages.text:
You prowl.
You stalk.
You spot .. a squirrel.

A mucus and phlegm atom bomb is forming inside your sinuses - ready to cover the little rodent in shame slime that can never been washed off.

You run up towards him and FUCKING SPIT him in the face. In slow-mo the loogie travels in a perfect trajectory (you even managed to get some green snot mixed with blood in there too) creating massive splash damage when hitting the squirrel right between the nose and the left eye!

Yeah!! That'll show that little bastard.

[[More bullying!|unic]]

<<set $spit = true>>

passages.name: skulk
passages.text: \n\n[[Skulk|skulk2]] some more..

passages.name: dmoped
passages.text:
"Why can't he just humor me when I try my very best to make him fit in? All the other boys likes everything you can start with a key"

Maybe playing for another team?
Playing for both teams?
Playing for no team?
Completely team-less - crossing the field without a shirt.

"Will he kiss girls if he doesn't like motors?"

[[choo choo!|train]]

<<set $dmoped = true>>

passages.name: dadwhere
passages.text:
@@opacity:0.5;Where's dad?@@

<<timedgoto "bbqmem" 1s>>

passages.name: dcharge
passages.text:
@@font-size: 180%; The Unicorn explodes its humongous frame towards you and your son - with a sharp horn ready to kill!!@@

[[Save me!|dsave]]
[[Save my son!|saveson]]

passages.name: saveson
passages.text:
You are not all.
You have lived a worthy life.
But your son still have a chance
of reaching those places
and mental wins you couldn't
even dream of due to poor
analog emoticons.

Farewell offspring.

[[continue|gameover]]

<<set $two = true>>

passages.name: saveme
passages.text:
You hide behind your
playhouse and peek out
from behind an already set
tea party planned to held
later that very same day
and sees how dad gets slaughtered
in front of your eyes.

The unicorn chucks
the dad-carcass away
and leaves - back the way
it came - through the shrubbery.

You flip the burgers
before they get burnt.

[[continue|gameover]]

<<set $three = true>>

passages.name: dfood
passages.text:
"It's not my fault he's fat. I'm not fat and I eat the same food he eats. Nothing wrong with some good food - enjoying life and making sure you're not hungry."

Candy hidden behind the bread.
Clanks heard throughout the night.
Different pieces sounding differently
when hitting the bowl.

His tongue embracing each sugary placebo.

Spreads, cold cuts and cheese in plenty.
Decorative greens drowning in cream.

[[choo choo|train]]

<<set $dfood = true>>

passages.name: child
passages.text:
Waking up is bliss.
Nightmare to reality or was it vice versa?

It's quiet...still.
The room (your room) is
everything right now.
Sometimes you've waken up
not knowing where you are - enjoying oblivion.

The room is cold and you
seek [[warmth|warmth]] in the hall.

passages.name: carryon
passages.text:
As you contemplate
how to feed your family - now
when you in a lousy manner
spoiled the feast that
was on everybody's mind - a train
of thought suddenly hits you
as you didn't pass the rails fast enough.

<<timedgoto "train" 10s>>

passages.name: kitchen
passages.text:
<<set $kitchen = true>>
A passionate cook and
an aspiring dad.

OCD cooking makes it hard
for you to fit in.

Remember when he asked you
to help?

[[Chop onion|chop]]

passages.name: box
passages.text:
<<if $skates and $moped and $money>>
Nothing more for you inside the box.
Its gutted remains lay lifeless in front of you.

@@font-size: 150%;[[Keep looking for dad|warmth]]@@
<<else>>
The dust on the lid falls to the floor.
The content strikes your tired eyes
as you suddenly........remembers.

A birthday gift without soul where not even the
thought counts.

A hope lit by gender expectations and cheered
on by dad.

A disappointment not hid creating repercussions where
joy is swapped for shame.

Memory lane is a fucking mental gauntlet.


<<if $skates>>
@@opacity:0.5; The Ice Skates@@
<<else>>
[[The Ice Skates|skates]]
<<endif>>

<<if $money>>
@@opacity:0.5; The Money Gift@@
<<else>>
[[The Money Gift|money]]
<<endif>>

<<if $moped>>
@@opacity:0.5; The Moped@@
<<else>>
[[The Moped|moped]]
<<endif>>
<<endif>>

passages.name: insert
bored
passages.text: \n\n[[Skulk|skulk]] to find new victims..

passages.name: duni
passages.text:
@@font-size: 180%; Suddenly!

A huge fucking Unicorn leaps out from a shrubbery that's perfect just the way it is!!@@

<<timedgoto "dcharge" 5s>>

passages.name: tapes
passages.text:
Apparently pubic hair is an abomination..
..white blood from meat oblongs..
..silent moans - dubbed - out of sync..
g-spots in hands and orifices.

craving the lukewarm molasses - a waterfall of discarded humans.

sex ed via the VCR - NOW with bonus language classes!

[[Continue the search|warmth]]

passages.name: daydream
passages.text:
<<set $daydream = true>>
You yearn for solitude.
To awake to a quiet earth
where you set the rules.

Dreams lacking the extraordinary.
Instead just longing not to be judged.
Screw driving Monster Trucks,
masturbating in shopping malls or
blowing stuff up.

You just want to eat a chocolate bar.
Alone. In broad daylight, not carefully
hiding the wrapper in the trashcan.

How one can dream..

[[Still no dad|warmth]]

passages.name: dcliff
passages.text:
"He picked the movie. I paid, but HE picked it, and WE watched it. Nothing girlie. But male. Fighting psychos on a fucking cold mountain is awesome. Blood, explosions, muscles (gay to watch them too long though), guns and other fun stuff"

A column written about TV time with dad, saved under stacks of paper, but saved nonetheless.

The TV babysits us both - being entertained by the VHS lottery - picking unlabeled tapes - maybe seeing a movie about a police shooting bad guys or a bad guy shooting the police.

[[choo choo|train]]

<<set $dcliff = true>>

passages.name: css passage
passages.text: (function(){ var render2 = Passage.prototype.render; Passage.prototype.render = function () { var b = render2.call(this); var t = this.tags.join(" "); document.body.setAttribute("data-tags", t); b.setAttribute("data-tags",t); return b; }; if(state) { var tgs = state.history[0].passage.tags.join(" "); var fc = $('passages').firstChild; fc.setAttribute("data-tags",tgs); }}());if(state) (function(){ var it = setInterval(function(){ var fd = $('passages').firstChild; if (fd!=fc) { clearInterval(it); fd.setAttribute("data-tags",tgs); } },0); }());

passages.name: flip
passages.text:
@@font-size: 150%;Flip them burgers!@@

[[Flip em!|flipthem]]

<<timedgoto "burntburger" 2s>>

passages.name: timer
dhead
passages.text:
"Calling just to hear how he's doing, and he's telling me HE's lonely.. HE LIVES IN A HUGE CITY - plenty of people there to see.. not like me living alone, in my house.. not a soul around."

Raised to feel nothing makes it hard to relate.
Probably cried in the tool shed when fetching coal and the grill.
How to handle non-physical disorder when tear ducts are blocked
with Y-chromosomes.

Feeble attempts to comfort.
But at least..attempts.

[[choo choo|train]]

<<set $dhead = true>>

passages.name: chop
passages.text:
Good work!

[[Fry onion|fry]]

passages.name: harass
passages.text:
How about some good old-fashioned mental harassment?
You know, really deconstruct someone.

There's this annoying moose that needs to be taught a lesson.

As usually he grazes (ON YOUR GRAZING SPOT!) near the old oak.

You spend the remainder of the day calling him:
*UGLY
*FAT
*RIPE FOR SLAUGHTER
*STUPID

The moose's sobbing soothes your mind.
This is so much better than listening to whale song when going to sleep..

[[I want more!!|unic]]

<<set $harass = true>>

passages.name: train
passages.text:
" Why can't he just enjoy the <<if $dmoped>>@@font-size: 150%;LIFE@@<<else>>[[moped|dmoped]]<<endif>> I gave him, and be grateful for it, and for all that fucking <<if $dmoney>>@@font-size: 150%;LOVE@@<<else>>[[money|dmoney]]<<endif>> that I throw away on him and all the <<if $dfood>>@@font-size: 150%;FAT@@<<else>>[[food|dfood]]<<endif>> I cook.. but it's always been like that, the boy is not normal in his <<if $dhead>>@@font-size: 150%;WAYS@@<<else>>[[head|dhead]]<<endif>>, failing <<if $dice>>@@font-size: 150%;ME@@<<else>>[[ice skating|dice]]<<endif>> when he was a kid.. and why can't he just leave my <<if $dshit>>@@font-size: 150%;FEELINGS@@ <<else>>[[stuff|dshit]]<<endif>> be.. and why can't we enjoy.... 

<<if $dcliff>>@@font-size: 150%;..MEMORIES@@<<else>>[[..Cliffhanger|dcliff]]<<endif>> again.......? "

<<if $dcliff and $dmoped and $dmoney and $dhead and $dshit and $dice and $dfood>>
<<timedgoto "myson" 5s>>
<<endif>>

passages.name: image loading
myson
passages.text:
Your son enters the lawn..

No!!

He presents himself on the lawn.
Hard to describe without "dad eyes".

<<if $burn>>
The shame of burnt food enters your mind.
What to do now? You can't fail your son as
you are his only salvation..
<<else>>
Culinary Peacocking - worthy of a champion!
Wait until he sees your carnivore like accomplishment..!
<<endif>>

<<timedgoto "duni" 10s>>

passages.name: dshit
passages.text:
"Order is good, a well organized kitchen is a must when cooking. Everything in place even in the tool shed, and why can't people have their kitchens just like I want them. It's nothing wrong with me, it's everybody else in the entire world."

Maybe people aren't that interesting..
..as they can't be labeled and organized.

Preferring spatulas before additional chefs.
A son begging like a dog - but nothing ever falls on the floor.

[[choo choo|train]]

<<set $dshit = true>>

passages.name: bbqmem
passages.text:
[IMG[http://corruptreality.files.wordpress.com/2013/09/bbq.png]] 

A small (happy) memory surfaces your mind.
@@font-size: 50%;[[Maybe outside, cooking?|bbq]]@@
